RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doutor (2012) e Mestre (2006) do Curso de Engenharia Eletrnica e Computao pelo ITA, possui graduao em Engenharia de Computao (2001). Atualmente Diretor Cientfico do IBRV, CTO e membro do conselho da empresa Norte Americana Drone USA e, comanda a empresa BRVANT - Solues Tecnolgicas, Empresa Estratgica de Defesa - EED, voltada ao desenvolvimento de Sistemas Aeronuticos, Softwares crticos e com aplicaes de tecnologias IoT, I.A., A.R e V.R., Simuladores, Veculos Areos No Tripulados (VANT), Veculos de Superfcie No Tripulados (USV) e terrestres (UGV). &#10;Tem experincia profissional na gesto de empresas, na elaborao e na gesto de projetos cientficos, no desenvolvimento de tecnologias disruptivas para a insero em mercados emergentes.&#10;Durante 5 anos foi membro da SAE Brasil e colaborador do Projeto Aerodesign atuando na organizao do evento e comisso tcnica.&#10;Como atividades extra curriculares, dedica-se na colaborao de forma voluntria e sem fins lucrativos na reviso de projetos Ad-Hoc da FAPESP, em Comisses de Assessoramento vinculados as suas reas de atuao, e na mentoria de empresas atravs dos programas MCTIC InovAtiva Brasil e o Programa MIT IIC.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: PhD (2012) and Master (2006) of the Electronic and Computer Engineering Course at ITA, holds a degree in Computer Engineering (2001). He is currently the Scientific Director of IBRV, CTO and member of the board of the North American company Drone USA and commands the company BRVANT - Solues Tecnolgicas, Strategic Defense Company - EED, focused on the development of Aeronautical Systems, Critical Software and with applications of IoT technologies , IA, AR and VR, Simulators, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USV) and Land Vehicles (UGV).&#10;He has professional experience in business management, in the development and management of scientific projects, in the development of disruptive technologies for insertion in emerging markets.&#10;For 5 years he was a member of SAE Brasil and collaborator of the Aerodesign Project working in the organization of the event and technical committee.&#10;As extra curricular activities, he dedicates himself to collaborating on a voluntary and non-profit basis in the review of FAPESP's Ad-Hoc projects, in Advisory Committees linked to his areas of expertise, and in mentoring companies through the MCTIC InovAtiva Brasil and the MIT IIC Program.
